history.content:
Not sure what schedule you're looking at, but I see two links (one and two) that indicate that there are a lot of classes that had never been taught before during the summer (i.e. 168, 169, 170, 189) as well as the only course that is traditionally offered during the summer (188) being offered this summer.

-- 

http://schedule.berkeley.edu/ <-- shows no CS upper divs for Summer 2017

history.content:
It's November and summer sessions start in June. We haven't hired lecturers for these courses yet, so they are not listed. We do hope to offer a handful assuming we can find instructors. 

The fact that these courses show up on classes.berkeley.edu is a mistake in how classes.berkeley.edu is currently set up.  We're really hoping to offer a # of upper division classes this summer.  At this point, it is almost certain (90%) that we will be able to offer 160 and 169.  We're working on others.
It's November and summer sessions start in June. We haven't hired lecturers for these courses yet, so they are not listed. We do hope to offer a handful assuming we can find instructors.
Just checked summer 2017 schedule and saw there were no CS classes offered in the summer. Is this subject to change?
history.subject: Are there no CS Upper divs offered next summer?
